description: This table contains the audit history for tasks that have been created or updated by the task engine. This table stores the following audit history for a task: triggering event, event source, event contact serial number (CSN), event time, and action taken on the task.

columns.name: TASK_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the task instance record.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.

columns.name: ADT_EVENT_C_NAME
columns.description:
Audit table for automatically created outpatient tasks - the event that created the task.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Admission


Undo Admission


Discharge


Undo Discharge


Emergency Department Arrival


Undo Emergency Department Arrival


Emergency Department Dismissal


Undo Emergency Department Dismissal

columns.name: EVENT_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category ID for the source of the event that triggered the automatic task change. 


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Internal


Internal


External

columns.name: EVENT_CSN_ID
columns.description: The unique contact serial number of the patient encounter that corresponds with the event that triggered the automatic task change.

columns.name: EVENT_TIME_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: Audit table for automatically created outpatient tasks - the timestamp of the event that created the task.

columns.name: ACTION_C_NAME
columns.description:
Audit table for automatically created outpatient tasks - the action the event took on the task.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Created


Created


Deleted


Added Medication


Removed Medication

columns.name: RX_FILL_ACTION_TYPE_C_NAME

columns.name: SRC_MEDICATION_ID
columns.description: Audit table for automatically created outpatient tasks - the medication that triggered a prescription fill status event.
